required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Oseltamivir (Tamiflu) for Treatment of Influenza in Immunocompromised Participants.
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-blind, Randomized, Stratified Multi-center Trial Evaluating Conventional and Double Dose Oseltamivir in the Treatment of Immunocompromised Patients With Influenza

brief_summary.textblock: This 2-arm study will investigate the safety and tolerability of oseltamivir for the treatment of influenza in immunocompromised participants and characterize the effects of oseltamivir in immunocompromised participants on the development of resistant influenza virus. Eligible immunocompromised participants with laboratory-confirmed influenza will be randomized to receive either conventional dose (30 milligrams [mg]-75mg twice daily orally [po], depending on age and weight) or double dose (60mg-150mg twice daily po depending on age and weight) Tamiflu for 10 days. Nasal and throat swabs will be taken, and safety evaluations made, at intervals during the study. The anticipated time on study medication is 10 days and the anticipated time on study is 40 days.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with adverse events
Percentage of participants who developed viral resistance to Tamiflu
Percentage of participants with tissue rejection or graft versus host disease (GVHD)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to alleviation of all clinical influenza symptoms
Percentage of participants with viral shedding assessed by culture and reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR)
Percentage of participants with viral load assessed by culture and RT-PCR
Percentage of participants who developed secondary illness (otitis media, bronchitis, pneumonia, or sinusitis)
Pharmacokinetics: Area under the concentration-time curve from 0 to 12 hours (AUC0-12) at steady state
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose
Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose
Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose
Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Time to maximum concentration (tmax), if appropriate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose
Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose
Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Apparent volume of distribution (Vc/F), if appropriate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Apparent total clearance of metabolite (CLm), if appropriate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Last measureable concentration (Clast), if appropriate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics: Time to last measureable concentration (tlast), if appropriate
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose (30 minutes), 1.5, 4, 8 hours (h) postdose on Day 6 or any day after the 11th dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants with each individual symptom score
Percentage of participants who initiated antibiotic treatment
Percentage of participants who had been hospitalized

arm_group.description: Immunocompromised participants will receive oseltamivir syrup at a dose ranging from 30 to 75 mg based on body weight, twice daily for children (1 to 12 years old) and oseltamivir capsules 75 mg twice daily for adults/adolescents greater than or equal to (>=13 years old) or placebo-matched to oseltamivir twice daily over 10 days.

Immunocompromised participants will receive oseltamivir syrup at a dose ranging from 60 to 150 mg based on body weight, twice daily for children (1 to 12 years old) and oseltamivir capsules 150 mg twice daily for adults/adolescents (>=13 years old) or placebo matched to oseltamivir twice daily over 10 days.

intervention.description: Dose ranging between 30 to 150 mg orally administered as syrup or capsules (depending on participants age and weight) po bid for 10 days
Placebo matched to oseltamivir po bid for 10 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Rapid diagnostic test, PCR, or viral culture positive for influenza in the 96 hours prior to first dose
- Immunocompromised participants with primary or secondary immunodeficiency
- Symptoms suggestive of influenza-like illness
- Use of an effective contraceptive, as specified by protocol; women of childbearing potential cannot be pregnant or breastfeeding
Exclusion Criteria:
- Influenza vaccination with live attenuated vaccine in the 2 weeks prior to randomization
- Antiviral treatment for influenza in 2 weeks prior to randomization
- Severe hepatic impairment
- Any current renal replacement therapy
- Any gastrointestinal disorders which may interfere with the absorption of oseltamivir
- Participation in a study with an investigational drug from 4 weeks prior to study start until study end
